YUSU Elections Candidates 2021 announced

02/03/2021

Find who the candidates are in this years' YUSU Elections

Image by YUSU

By Elizabeth Walsh

Earlier today (2 March), Vision announced the candidates for this yearsâ€™ elections. For the main five Sabb positions, there has been an increase in the number of candidates; last year 14 people ran for either YUSU President, Sport President, Activities, Academic, or Community and Wellbeing, this year 18 people are running across the board - an increase of four.

Despite the lack of Activities going on this year, the number of candidates running for Activities Officer is the highest with eight candidates, which doubles last yearsâ€™ four. On the opposite side, the role with the least number of candidates running is Academic, which sees Matt Johnstone, current Academic Officer, as the only candidate.

Today's announcement marks the beginning of the election season, with URY Candidate Interview night occurring tonight and candidate debate night going ahead on 5 March. 5 March marks the date when voting opens, voting will close on 12 March, with the winners revealed the following day.

Vision have compiled all the candidatesâ€™ manifestos on their site here Â and listed below are the names of all candidates running in the 2021 Elections:
